column4: anyone?  If you cant help directly could you at least help me figure out what would be the most beneficial thing to search for to resolve my problem?
which ones?  My system gets stuck at the (initramfs) prompt I guess it is.
can press ctrl + alt + f1 at boot to see some errors?
ctrl + alt + f1 did nothing when my system stopped at (initramfs).
so what do I do now?
that is a good question, i dont know, sorry
any ideas as to what I should search around for?
I get nothing.  Is there a way I could purge the kernel update and try again?
or possible purge all of the updates that happened last.
just dont use the newer kernel?
like hit escape each time and manually select it from the list?
just make 2.6.28-14 the deault entry until you found a solution
hey whats the difference between marking for removal and marking for complete removal in synaptic?
